metadata.title: CVE-2019-1353 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was found in Git before v2.24.1, v2.23.1, v2.22.2, v2.21.1,v2.20.2, v2.19.3, v2.18.2, v2.17.3, v2.16.6, v2.15.4, and v2.14.6. Whenrunning Git in the Windows Subsystem for Linux (also known as "WSL") whileaccessing a working directory on a regular Windows drive, none of the NTFSprotections were active.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1353` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-all - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-cvs - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-daemon-run - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-el - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-email - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-gui - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-man - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-mediawiki - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
git-svn - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
gitk - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
gitweb - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.5').
